intro: Semele maderensis subvar. presbytera, commonly known as the Maderan rock orchid, is a rare and endemic plant found in specific rocky habitats in Portugal. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, often pale-colored flowers with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows in sunny, well-drained soils on limestone or granite substrates. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
